meanings.definition: The quality or state of being orthogonal.
meanings.sent1: The orthogonality of the lines made it easy to see they were perpendicular.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter ensured the orthogonality of the corners in the frame.
meanings.sent3: The strict orthogonality of the teacher's rules made the students giggle.
meanings.sent4: The orthogonality of their opinions created a divide that could not be bridged.
meanings.sent5: The perfect orthogonality of the chessboard squares was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: The property of being at right angles.
meanings.sent1: The orthogonality of the intersecting roads made navigation simple.
meanings.sent2: The engineer carefully measured the orthogonality of the beams before construction.
meanings.sent3: The orthogonality of the cat's ears always made it look surprised.
meanings.sent4: The orthogonality of the tree branches against the sky was a striking sight.
meanings.sent5: The orthogonality of the shadows at noon created a perfect grid on the ground.
